intro: [WRONG START] S-tevia seemannii var. selerorum, commonly known as the sweetleaf plant, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant is notable for its high concentration of steviol glycosides, which are natural sweeteners. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in tropical and subtropical regions. Its use in traditional medicine and as a natural sweetener has gained increasing recognition in recent years.
